description.narrative: To improve the quality of tourism and solid waste management services and increase the resilience of the tourism sector to the impacts of natural disasters in the provinces of Calca, Urubamba, and Cusco.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Project Coordination Committee | Description :Schedule 2, Section I, B, 1 (a): The Borrower shall cause theRegion of Cusco, acting through PER Plan COPESCO, to establish by no later than December 31, 2013, and thereafter operate andmaintain throughout the period of implementation of Project activities, a Project Coordination Committee. | Due Date :31-Dec-2013

Finance Agreement :Technical Working Groups | Description :Schedule 2, Section I, B, 1 (b): The Borrower shall cause the Region ofCusco, acting through PER Plan COPESCO, to establish by no later than December 31, 2013, and thereafter operate and maintainthroughout the period of implementation of Project activities, three Technical Working Groups, one for each of Components 1, 2 and3 of the Project. | Due Date :31-Dec-2013

title.narrative: Informal and formalized recyclers (households) benefiting from Project social inclusion activities.
Number of people (tourists and residents) in the Project area from whom waste is collected and disposed in one of the Project sanitary landfills
Industrial and municipal waste disposal capacity (per year) created under the project
Number of Provincial sanitary landfills constructed under the Project
Number of municipalities provided with equipment and works for improved collection, recycling and street sweeping
Pilot Competitive Fund for Tourism for small businesses in the Sacred Valley operational
Strategic Regional Plan updated for prevention and reduction of disaster risk
